result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both ATV or UTV-Cause Injury w/ PAC .08%+ and ATV or UTV-Cause Injury/While Intoxicated. The defendant was found guilty of ATV or UTV-Cause Injury w/ PAC .08%+ and the other charge, ATV or UTV-Cause Injury/While Intoxicated was dismissed by the court.

  • Sherri Marie Kaad was found guilty of ATV or UTV-Cause Injury w/ PAC .08%+, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 23.33(4c)(b)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Must complete AODA assessment with follow through with recommendations.
May not consume or possess alcohol.
May not enter any bars or taverns.

records.addlTxt:
8:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Douglas J Drexler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherri Marie Kaad in court.  Attorney Gregory Paul Seibold in court for Sherri Marie Kaad. Statement by State. Motion by State to dismiss Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 1 upon State's motion.  Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 2. Plea is freely, voluntarily, and intelligently given. Constitutional rights read and waived. Court finds defendant guilty due to no contest plea. Statement by State. Statement by Attorney Seibold. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences defendant to one year probation, must complete AODA assessment with follow through, complete 40 hours community service, may not consume or possess alcohol, may not enter any bars or taverns, serve 30 days jail, 1 day credit, good time granted, huber granted, must report to jail on 8/5/22 by 8:30am, must submit DNA sample, pay $1,000 fine plus court costs due within 60 days of release of custody or commitment order. Appeal rights given. Adj. 9:33am jjm
Restitution hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Restitution hearing on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Douglas J Drexler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sherri Marie Kaad in court.  Attorney Gregory Paul Seibold in court for Sherri Marie Kaad. Defendant enters not guilty plea. Court continues bond. Adj. 11:12am jjm
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
